009
010package imagingbook.common.regions;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D.N4;
013
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.Collections;
016import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.Map;
019
020import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
022
023/**
024 * Performs region segmentation on a given binary image. This class is abstract,
025 * since the implementation depends on the concrete region segmentation
026 * algorithm being used. Concrete implementations (subclasses of this class) are
027 * {@link BreadthFirstSegmentation}, {@link DepthFirstSegmentation},
028 * {@link RecursiveSegmentation}, {@link SequentialSegmentation},
029 * {@link RegionContourSegmentation}.
030 * 
031 * Most of the work is done by the constructor(s). If the segmentation has
032 * failed for some reason {@link #getRegions()} returns {@code null}.
033 * 
034 * @version 2021/12/22
035 */
036public abstract class BinaryRegionSegmentation {
037        
038        /** The default neighborhood type. */
039        public static final NeighborhoodType2D DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD = N4;
040        
041        static final int BACKGROUND = 0;
042        static final int FOREGROUND = 1;
043        
044//      final ImageProcessor ip;
045        final int width;
046        final int height;       
047        final NeighborhoodType2D NT;
048        
049        final int[][] labelArray;
050        // label values in labelArray can be:
051        //  0 ... unlabeled
052        // -1 ... previously visited background pixel
053        // >0 ... valid label
054        
055        private final Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> regions;
056        private final boolean isSegmented;
057        
058        private final int minLabel = 2;
059        private int currentLabel = -1;  // the maximum label assigned sofar
060        private int maxLabel = -1;              // the maximum label assigned total
061        
062        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
063        
064        BinaryRegionSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType2D nh) {
065//              this.ip = ip;
066                this.NT = nh;
067                this.width  = ip.getWidth();
068                this.height = ip.getHeight();
069                this.labelArray = makeLabelArray(ip);
070                this.isSegmented = applySegmentation(ip);
071                this.regions = (isSegmented) ? collectRegions() : Collections.emptyMap();
072        }
073        
074        int[][] makeLabelArray(ByteProcessor ip) {
075                int[][] lA = new int[width][height];    // label array
076                // set all pixels to either FOREGROUND or BACKGROUND (by thresholding)
077                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
078                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
079                                lA[u][v] = (ip.get(u, v) != 0) ? FOREGROUND : BACKGROUND;
080                        }
081                }
082                return lA;
083        }
084        
085        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
086        
087        /**
088         * This method must be implemented by all concrete sub-classes.
089         * @param ip TODO
090         * 
091         * @return true if segmentation was successful
092         */
093        abstract boolean applySegmentation(ByteProcessor ip);
094        
095        /**
096         * Returns the width of the segmented image. 
097         * @return the width of the segmented image
098         */
099        public int getWidth() {
100                return this.width;
101        }
102        
103        /**
104         * Returns the height of the segmented image. 
105         * @return the height of the segmented image
106         */
107        public int getHeight() {
108                return this.height;
109        }
110        
111        /**
112         * Returns the minimum label assigned by this segmentation.
113         * @return the minimum label
114         */
115        public int getMinLabel() {
116                return minLabel;
117        }
118        
119        /**
120         * Returns the maximum label assigned by this segmentation.
121         * @return the maximum label
122         */
123        public int getMaxLabel() {
124                return maxLabel;
125        }
126        
127        /**
128         * Returns true if the segmentation did complete successfully,
129         * false otherwise.
130         * 
131         * @return true if segmentation was successful
132         */
133        public boolean isSegmented() {
134                return isSegmented;
135        }
136        
137        /**
138         * Returns an unsorted list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
139         * The returned list is empty if no regions were detected.
140         * See also {@link #getRegions(boolean)}.
141         * 
142         * @return a (possibly empty) list of detected regions
143         */
144        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions() {
145                return getRegions(false);       // unsorted
146        }
147        
148        /**
149         * Returns a (optionally sorted) list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
150         * The returned list is empty if no regions were detected.
151         * 
152         * @param sort set {@code true} to sort regions by size (largest regions first).
153         * @return the list of detected regions or {@code null} if the segmentation has failed.
154         */
155        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions(boolean sort) {
156                if (regions == null) {
157                        throw new RuntimeException("regions is null, this should never happen");
158                }
159                BinaryRegion[] ra = regions.values().toArray(new BinaryRegion[0]);
160                if (sort) {
161                        Arrays.sort(ra);
162                }
163                return Arrays.asList(ra);
164        }
165        
166        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
167        
168        /**
169         * Creates a (map) container of {@link BinaryRegion} objects,
170         * collects the region pixels from the label image
171         * and calls {@link SegmentationBackedRegion#update()} to compute
172         * the statistics for each region.
173         * Region label numbers serve as map keys.
174         * @return a map of {@link BinaryRegion} instances.
175         */
176        Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> collectRegions() {
177                SegmentationBackedRegion[] regionArray = new SegmentationBackedRegion[maxLabel + 1];
178                for (int label = minLabel; label <= maxLabel; label++) {
179                        regionArray[label] = new SegmentationBackedRegion(label, this);
180                }
181                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
182                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
183                                int label = getLabel(u, v);
184                                if (label >= minLabel && label <= maxLabel && regionArray[label] != null) {
185                                        regionArray[label].addPixel(u, v);
186                                }
187                        }
188                }
189                // create a list of regions to return, collect nonempty regions
190                Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> regionMap = new LinkedHashMap<>();
191                for (SegmentationBackedRegion r: regionArray) {
192                        if (r != null && r.getSize() > 0) {
193                                r.update();     // compute the statistics for this region
194                                regionMap.put(r.getLabel(), r); //add(r);
195                        }
196                }
197                return regionMap;
198        }
199        
200        /**
201         * Returns the label number for the specified image coordinate.
202         * -1 is returned for out-of-image coordinates.
203         * 
204         * @param u the horizontal coordinate.
205         * @param v the vertical coordinate.
206         * @return the label number for the given position or -1 if outside the image
207         */
208        public int getLabel(int u, int v) {
209                return (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height) ? labelArray[u][v] : -1;
210        }
211        
212        void setLabel(int u, int v, int label) {
213                if (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height)
214                        labelArray[u][v] = label;
215        }
216        
217        int getNextLabel() {
218                currentLabel = (currentLabel < 1) ? minLabel : currentLabel + 1;
219                maxLabel = currentLabel;
220                return currentLabel;
221        }
222        
223        boolean isRegionLabel(int i) {
224                return (i >= minLabel);
225        }
226
227        // --------------------------------------------------
228
229        /**
230         * Finds the region associated to the specified label
231         * or {@code null} if no region for that label exists.
232         * 
233         * @param label the region's label number
234         * @return the region object associated with the given label
235         *              or {@code null} if it does not exist
236         */
237        public SegmentationBackedRegion getRegion(int label) {
238                return (label < minLabel || label > maxLabel) ? null : regions.get(label);
239        }
240        
241        /**
242         * Returns the {@link BinaryRegion} instance associated with
243         * the given image position or {@code null} if the segmentation
244         * contains no region covering the given position.
245         * 
246         * @param u the horizontal position.
247         * @param v the vertical position.
248         * @return The associated {@link BinaryRegion} object or {@code null} if
249         *              this {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} has no region at the given position.
250         */
251        public SegmentationBackedRegion getRegion(int u, int v) {
252                return getRegion(getLabel(u, v));
253        }
254
255}
